posts.title: Ah Gözel Istanbul
posts.excerpt: Quote:A cinematic travelogue in contemporary Istanbul, based on Eremya Komurciyan’s ‘History of Istanbul in the 17th Century.’

posts.excerpt: “Haru no mezame” was Naruse’s third full-lenth post-war film — and a delightful surprise. posts._title: Phil Karlson – The Phenix City Story (1955)
posts.title: The Phenix City Story
posts.excerpt: Quote:I’ve always cited this movie as the best ever made in (Alabama), as well as the most authentic. posts.title: Les cousins
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Charles is a young provincial coming up to Paris to study law. He shares his cousin Paul’s flat. Paul is a kind of decadent boy, a disillusioned pleasure-seeker, always dragging along with other idles, while Charles is a plodding, naive and honest man. He fell in love with Florence, one of Paul’s acquaintances. But how …

posts.title: Cinetracts ’20
posts.excerpt: In 1968, a group of French filmmakers including Jean-Luc Godard and Chris Marker crafted short, quickly made cinematic responses to the political and social upheaval that shook Paris in May of that year. Inspired in part by this project, called Cinétracts, the Wexner Center commissioned 20 short films by filmmakers from around the world. See …

posts.title: Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia
posts.excerpt: Quote:A family scandal causes a wealthy and powerful Mexican rancher to make the pronouncement–‘Bring me the head of Alfredo Garcia!’ Two of the bounty-hunters thus dispatched encounter a local piano-player in their hunt for information. posts.title: Ôsaka no yado
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Mr. Mito (Shuji Sano), a Tokyo businessman, is demoted and sent to Osaka. There, he finds lodging in the titular inn, and makes the acquaintance of many of the town’s citizens. posts._title: Ömür Atay, Selim Demirdelen, Kudret Sabanci, Yücel Yolcu, Ümit Ünal – Anlat Istanbul AKA Istanbul Tales (2005)
posts.title: Anlat Istanbul
posts.excerpt: Quote:Istanbul Tales is a film which tells five interconnected stories set in modern-day Istanbul based on the fairy tales Snow White, Cinderella, Pied Piper, Sleeping Beauty and Little Red Riding Hood. The film, which went on nationwide general release on 11 March 2005, won several awards including Best Film at the 24th International Istanbul Film …

posts._title: Werner Herzog – My Son, My Son, What Have Ye Done (2009)
posts.title: My Son, My Son, What Have Ye Done
posts.excerpt: Quote:Inspired by a true crime, a man begins to experience mystifying events that lead him to slay his mother with a sword.
